name: Millennium Hilton Bangkok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 nights at the end of a month tour of the far east. Wanted something better than a hostel where we could lounge by the pool and relax in comfort before the long flight back to reality!
reviews.title: Just OK, no where near as good as made out in other reviews.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in was fine and our room was on the 16th floor - amazing views over the city and the river. King Size bed, cotton sheets, room bit small for the size of the furniture as it didn't all fit and when you walked round the room you, couldn't just walk round without having to move a chair out of the way (my boyfriend and i aren't fat either!)
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: The bar 360 which they recommend for sunset is ridiculously over priced at £10 a cocktail! Plus due to the deign of the building you can't actually see the sunset!
reviews.title: So great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Since the hotel is on the 'wrong' side of the river it does run a free boat service every 20 mins from 6am to 12pm. Assign at least another 30 mins to anything you do to allow for waiting for the boat and travelling on it. Staff are very polite and the boat ride is quite nice but the experience does tend to wear thin (i've been ti bangkok quite a few times before).
reviews.title: fabulous hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool is crap and so is the sun area. Pointless cause its north facing so only a quarter of it gets the sun plus its only on the 4th floor. There is a fake beach for the kids too play in which never sees the sun. If you want to sun bath you'll end up wedged between the edge of the building and a hedge - not really all that nice, especially for the amount of money paid for the room! You are best off if you want to sun your self and relax staying at a hotel which has a proper roof top pool or one that actually faces south! I.e. on the other side of the river!
reviews.title: Absolutly Beautiful !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008
reviews.text: We stayed in an exec suite at the Hilton for a few nights in November as a base for exploring Bangkok on holiday.
reviews.title: A good Bangkok base

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A few comments:
reviews.title: Attention to Detail

likes.liked: — Service and the decor. The room design was very unique

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: - it is possible to get fairly reasonable rates for the exec suites if you book far enough in advance. The suites are large, well appointed, very comfortable and have great views. You also get access to the exec lounge which does good breakfasts and a free bar for an hour or so each evening. However, it does seem to be quite easy to break the seemingly unwritten dress code for the lounge (we found out that women's fairly formal toeless shoes are apparently not allowed)
reviews.title: The best executive lounge ever

likes.liked: — The view from lounge and the pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - we took a hotel car from the airport, which makes it very easy on arrival. It was very comfortable, with good aircon, complimentary water etc. You do, however, pay a hefty premium - we got a taxi on the way back which was cheaper, although obviously somewhat more basic
reviews.title: Wonderful service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - the 360 degree bar on the 32nd floor has excellent views and good service, although the drinks are priced accordingly
reviews.title: great hotel

likes.liked: — pool on the 4th floor and convenience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hilton for the Christmas days.
reviews.title: Magnificent hotel - with a expensive price tag :)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We wanted something special while away from home, and we definitely thought this place was magnificent.
reviews.title: Bangkok no, Millenium yes

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The terrace, restaurants and pool definitely are beautiful, much better than in other hotels at the same level.
reviews.title: Best City Hotel in Bangkok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Worth mentioning that nothing was included in the price (180$ US) - no breakfast, no wifi, nor welcome drinks. We weren't expecting this, but having travelled through other Asian cities, the hotel should at least provide breakfast for this price.
reviews.title: Excellence that exceeded my expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are well decorated and clean, and have a fantastic view, but they are small.
reviews.title: Fantastic communial areas!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As a Hilton Rewards Member, I stayed for 6 free nights at the Millenium Hilton in Bangkok. The service at this hotel is great with a friendly staff. The room was pleasant and had a good view of the Chao Priya River. Ate at their buffet breakfast at the Flow a few times which is okay if you want to have a river view. The food stayed the same the 3 times I ate there with no variations and considering it was about $30 USD a person, was high considering you could eat much cheaper outside of the hotel.
reviews.title: Celebrated NYE in Bangkok and stayed at the Millenium

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Location is opposite the ferries used to get around the Chao Priya River so you have to wait for the Hilton ferry if you wish to use the river transportation or the MRT. We celebrated on a River cruise for NYE which ended at 1am and even though we were a river away from the Hilton hotel, they did not extend the cross ferry boat later that night for New Years partygoers and thus had to find our own transportation back to the hotel. So if you plan to stay at the Millenium, keep in mind you have to be back before midnight or else you will be responsible for you to get back to the hotel.
reviews.title: 5 STAR HOTEL HOVERING OVER CHAO PHRAYA!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had my best sleep in Bangkok while staying at the Hilton. We arrived late in the evening and the hotel lobby was so quite. A friendly hotel bellman assisted us towards the check-in area and their friendly staff took it from there. We stayed at the 18th floor with a commanding view of the city. Looking outside the window, the golden glow of the city shines on us. Waking up in the morning is difficult as the bed and pillows makes you wanna stay longer. Everything inside the room is inspiring except for the old school tv which is no big deal though. The view outside our window is the magnificient Chao Phraya river and the rest of bangkok. I love the bathroom with speakers connected to the tv direct. The vanity kit courtesy of evelyn and crabtree are to die for. The bath tub and the rainshower-oh i wish they're mine to take home.
reviews.title: simply wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I booked a one night stop over at this hotel. We wished we had longer. The hotel is outstanding in every respect. The staff, the furnishings, the view from our room, the comfort and the location were simply wonderful. Bangkok assualts all the senses in the most positive way, and the location of the hotel affords the opportunity to enjoy it all. But you need more a lot more than one night to fully enjoy the hotel and its surroundings. Two tips. Don't miss the hotel's Prime restaurant -- incredible food. If you are going to see the Grand Palace (home of the Emerald Buddha) take seriously the warnings about "wily strangers". We were told by more than one very official looking man that the Palace was closed and urged to take a Tuk Tuk elsewhere. Fortunately we were not persuaded.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel : should improve check in time.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stay in the executive suite for New year's eve. The room has magnificent view of the river. Decoration is modern and comfortable. Wifi only free in public areas, in room charges. Breakfast has good spread of food. Room service also good. (the food comes with the whole table.) The only drawback is the check in time : we were brought to executive lounge and waited more than 30 mins and was told the room hasn't finish yet.
reviews.title: The hotel offers free internet .

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I must say the photos do not do this place justice. It is such a lovely hotel. Its big, has different bars to relax in, is very very clean and the staff are lovely. If you upgrade to the executive room it is well worth it. You get breakfast served in a different part of the hotel, internet access, afternoon tea and free alcoholic drinks with snacks in the evening. Well worth the extra money. Great location, right on the river. The pool area is lovely and they had a wedding reception there so that should give you an idea of how nice it is. Only negative is that the drinks in the 360 bar and others in the hotel are very expensive. Soft drinks are about five pounds and the cocktails about 15 pounds, then they add TAX, VAT, service charge etc on to that. Overall though a pleasant 2 night stay.
reviews.title: Great stay, great value, go Executive!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights at the start of our honeymoon. What a wonderful arrival, greeted with cool drinks and cold wash cloths. Because it was our honeymoon, the hotel kindly upgraded us to a fabulous suite with amazing views over the Bangkok river, with a large panoramic window.
reviews.title: Professional, Friendly, and Welcoming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff here are a credit to Hilton (after staying in many). The location of the hotel is very handy with easy courtesy river links to the centre of Bangkok.
reviews.title: Treated as Royalty

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Some of the extra honeymoon touches were wonderful (Strawberries dipped in chocolate, fruit selection, petals on the bed)
reviews.title: 5 star accom for a fraction of the price, right on the river

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010
reviews.text: The breakfast was wonderful with an extensive selection and very attentive staff.
reviews.title: Good hotel with small rooms - doesn't compare with Bangkok's best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for the first 2 nights we were in Thailand for our honeymoon.
reviews.title: A great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself is of a very high standard, your first impression is of the lobby which is very impressive.
reviews.title: You'll never forget the view!

likes.liked: — Executive lounge, the suite, the amazing views!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: I was slightly dissapointed not to be upgraded to a deluxe suite, our travel agent had made it clear we were honeymooners but this did not hold any weight. We were offered an upgrade but at quite a high cost.
reviews.title: Nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was substancial and had an excellent view of the river, i believe all rooms in this hotel have a river view.
reviews.title: Simply WOW!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We ate lunch in the hotel and it was satisfactory, certainly not the greatest lunch we had and rather expensive for what it was. Although the buffet selection looked amazing if you wanted anything more than a snack.
reviews.title: Thieves at 5 Star breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed there for one night on our way back from Australia. Everything about the hotel was absolutely superb, we could not fault it in any way. The 360 cocktail and jazz bar on the 36th (or so) floor is fab and fully recommended for cool hanging out and cocktails with panoramic views. The food in the 'Flow' restaurant was excellent too.
reviews.title: Superb hotel in very central location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008
reviews.text: Right on the river this hotel was central to everything.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Perfect location on the river bank. New and stylish hotel with contemporary design. Very nice and attentive staff. The garden and pool facilities are just amazing. Will definately return to this hotel.
reviews.title: Top notch hotel in great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here on our last night in Bangkok and were really impressed. The food is great (try the buffet, pricey but great, or have lunch in the waterfront restuarant), the cocktails lovely too.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's pretty impressive, very tall! The cheesy hotel bar at the top is nice for a view and a cocktail.
reviews.title: Wonderful start to Thailand

likes.liked: — The wonderful spacious rooms with ever detail (ducks on bath - silk elephant on pillow)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Both husband and I stopped over in Bangkok for 4 nights on our way to Koi Samui. We were greeted with lovely cool refreshments and cold towels. Check in was quick and easy. Staff were helpful and could not do more for you.
reviews.title: Loved the Hilton..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As it was our 2nd wedding anniversary, our room was decorated with a bottle of champagne and fresh fruit. On our 1 day stay back from Koi Samui we had a lovely card to welcome us both back to the hotel.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008
reviews.text: We stayed on the executive floor for three nights and one night on the 29th floor. To my surprise, I much preferred the 29th floor, the room was much more spacious and lighting was better within the room than the exec floor's room.
reviews.title: Oh my..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We had a lovely time and ate at the restaurant on all four days. I would say the location is perfect and it cost no more than 75 BHT to get to the main districts. We would def go back..
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just came back from our 8 days May holidays in Bangkok.
reviews.title: Pefect place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely new hotel with sweeping views of the river. Very friendly staff, there's a shuttle boat service to the BTS station and the River City Mall across the river.
reviews.title: Excellent new hotel - great views, small rooms, expensive internet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The breakfast is great though not exceptional, and the Flow restaurant/coffee shop is beautifully designed with the lobby spilling on to it and the restaurant spilling on to the river.
reviews.title: not dissapointed
Excellent!
reviews.text: The other restaurants seemed ok, but didn't have any 'buzz'. Maybe that's because the hotel is new and will get popular with time. We went to the rooftop bar and the other bar/club on a sat. night and they were quite deserted!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The standard rooms are quite small though. There's no proper work desk/chair. If I'd been there on business, I'd have found working there quite uncomfortable. Even otherwise, there's barely space to leave some bags and stuff. The bathroom is, however, quite generous-sized (they could have put a larger washbasin, though).
reviews.title: Amazing

likes.liked: — Staff and the roof top cocktail bar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Another con is the expensive internet access - 625 baht for 24 hours, which is pretty expensive for a leisure traveller who just wants to check his mail once a day.
reviews.title: Just wow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Millenium Hilton for 3 days before traveling to Phuket for the remainder of our honeymoon. It was a gorgeous hotel, with very comfortable beds and nice amenities. We loved being right on the river and traveling around the city is incredibly cheap. The hotel provides a boat shuttle to the skytrain, and you can get anywhere in the city from there. In addition, taxis cost next to nothing. The hotel provided a map, and we just pointed to whatever we wanted to see. Most trips in a taxi were less than $2 (US).
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

likes.liked: — Clean and comfortable, with fantastic service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The pool was great and the staff was excellent. Breakfast every morning was fantastic! We ate huge breakfasts and were usually not hungry at all throughout the day. The hotel bar is pricey--especially compared to the cheap eats and drinks every where else in the city.
reviews.title: spectacular views of bangkok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: Our only complaint was the charge for internet access. In a hotel of this caliber, I think the internet should be free.
reviews.title: A friendly bunch, a great stay, stylish pool area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Went here for a change from Sukhumvit/Ploenchit area, and pleasantly surprised by the hotel, the best part of which is the river side restaurant , where breakfast is served...
reviews.title: Great hotel !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooftop bar was hugely over priced ,tho the views are spectacular,.The rooms like any normal 5 star hotel.
reviews.title: Slightly disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed 7-10 January 2011, King Executive plus suite #1901
reviews.title: Excellent views and professional staff but room décor impersonal.
Value for money
reviews.text: Initially bit disappointed but hotel grows on you. Service is excellent; very friendly, quick and professional. Suite was large with fantastic views over the Bangkok and Chao Praya River. Surprisingly pretty small bathroom, but nice bathroom amenities. Room décor a bit dull – not Thai nor modern design. More like a contemporary business room style. The bed was very comfortable! Annoying hotel charge for internet in room (free at executive lounge). Very nice executive lounge on 31st floor (indoor/outdoor). Stunning views. Complimentary snacks and refreshments offered throughout the day (although complimentary alcoholic beverages only offered between 6-8 pm). Great views from Three sixty lounge on 32nd floor. Pool area on 4th floor mediocre. Not enough sun loungers. Not sure placing sun loungers in the water a good idea since very limited place to put your belongings and easy to drop your book or mobile phone in the cold water. Sun loungers uncomfortable and hard to adjust. No complimentary water service. Large, modern and excellent gym at the same floor. Hotel entrance impressive. Flow restaurant with stunning river views is excellent! Really pretty décor. Tried their buffet which was outstanding. Cheese room alone is worth exploring! Recommend to take one hour private canal tour organized by hotel on their own boat (not longtail). When leaving had a much better impression of the hotel although think pool area at Peninsula superior and if you looking for a more Thai décor/style hotel would go elsewhere (like Peninsula, Oriental or Sukhothai). But definitely value for money.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We came here because of an Expedia special offer and everything about this hotel was special. Top service, large rooms and very modern. Staff are very nice and the bell boys were always trying to help whether we had a little shopping bag or large cases. One thing I liked about the bell boys is that once they have done their job, they don´t just stand there waiting for their tips and they walk away, though we always made sure to give them a little tip.
reviews.title: Beautiful Design Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: The view of our room was nice and although we had booked it through a special offer they did not try to give us an average room.
reviews.title: Were that they were all this good!
Executive suite life is SWEET!
reviews.text: I am not sure if we´ll go back to Bangkok as we have seen it and done it, but if we were to go back we would stay here.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our stay at the Millenium to say the least was by far one of the most relaxing and exhilarating holidays we have experienced as a family. From the moment we checked in we were greeted with the utmost courtesy and friendliness. The ambience of the whole building exudes with typical Thai culture and superb comfort. Location wise one can avail ones self to the complimentary boat trip to the connecting sky train. Connections to and from the airport were also most reliable. Having availed ourselves of the facilities on level 31 we were more than satisfied. Overall a most impressive hotel which has lived up to all expectations and which gives one an everlasting experience and insight into Asian
reviews.title: Fabulous Family Holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: hospitality and friendliness.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel occupies a wonderfule location right on the Chayo Praya river. The views from the roof at night are brilliant. The hotel is very modern and staff is a delight. Bangkok is so huge that I would not necessarily consider this hotel centrally located. However, if you are travelling with family or as a couple the location is perfect. The gym is great and the bar at the top of the hotel is incredible. We did not eat here much but the food looked good. Rooms are made up twice a day and everyone is eager to please. Woudl definitely return.
reviews.title: Very responsive and friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I vacationed her for three nights in November. Like many others, we stayed on the executive level floors which allowed access to the executive lounge.
reviews.title: Excellent choice in Bangkok
Loved this hotel
reviews.text: The room itself was nice - the bathroom especially so. Separate bath and shower, toilet separated from the main bath and large enough floor area to not feel cramped.

description: A stunning new ultra-contemporary hotel with absolute river views from every window. Boasting outdoor infinity pool, stand alone full service Spa and a dedicated Hilton Meetings floor. Eight restaurants and bars offer exquisite local and western cuisine and cocktails to suit every palate in indoor and outdoor settings. Complimentary shuttle boat to the heart of city runs until midnight. Grand Palace, Reclining Buddha and the Temple of Dawn are just a short boat ride away.
